message:
Dr. Muhammad Abu Salmiya, director of the Shifa hospital in Gaza, on the uproar in Israel surrounding his release:

I am surprised at the reports that officials in the (Israeli - AA) government did not know about my release. I was officially released. The occupation did not file an indictment against me even though I was brought before a judge three times.
event_breakdown: The target event is the uproar in Israel surrounding the release of Dr. Muhammad Abu Salmiya, director of the Shifa hospital in Gaza. The event can be placed on a map as it specifically mentions Israel.

message: Additional documentation of the vehicle that was hit by a explosive in the Nur Shams camp in Tulkarm.
location: The explosion occurred in Nur Shams camp in Tulkarm, a Palestinian refugee camp in the West Bank.
event_breakdown:
* On June 23, 2022, a vehicle was hit by a roadside bomb in the Nur Shams camp in Tulkarm, Palestine. There were no immediate reports of injuries.
* On June 21, 2022, a suicide bomber detonated explosives in a crowded market in Sadr City, Baghdad, Iraq. At least 20 people were killed and dozens more were injured in the attack.
* On June 14, 2022, a military bus was hit by a bomb in the Syrian city of Homs, killing four people and injuring several others. the Islamic State group claimed responsibility for the attack.
* On June 4, 2022, a bomb exploded in a marketplace in the Iraqi city of Khanaqin, killing at least three people and injuring many more. No group claimed responsibility for the attack, but the Islamic State group is known to operate in Khanaqin.
* On May 28, 2022, a suicide bomber detonated explosives in a busy market in the Afghan city of Kunduz, killing at least 24 people and injuring more than 50 others. No group claimed responsibility for the attack, but the Islamic State group is known to operate in Kunduz.

message: IDF forces are evacuating a military vehicle that was hit by an explosive device during an operation in the Nur Shams refugee camp in Tulkarm.
event_breakdown: IDF evacuates military vehicle hit by explosive device in Nur Shams refugee camp, Tulkarm.

message:
Paris: Supporters of the left-wing parties are protesting the rise in power of the right-wing party led by Marine Le Pen in the first round of parliamentary elections in France.

Clashes with the police, firing of tear gas and destruction of shops were documented.
event_breakdown: Clashes between police and protesters in Paris, France during an anti-far-right demonstration. The protesters were demonstrating against the rise of the far-right party in the polls ahead of the first round of parliamentary elections. Tear gas was fired and shop windows were smashed during clashes with the police.

message: Palestinian channels publish (Israeli) documentation of the Rafah crossing in its new form...
event_breakdown:
Israeli Documentation of the Rafah Crossing
The Israeli government has released new documentation of the Rafah border crossing between the Gaza Strip and Egypt. The crossings were previously closed for security reasons, but have been reopened to help with humanitarian efforts in the region.

The documentation includes maps of the border crossings, as well as detailed information about the security measures that are in place. It also includes information about the types of goods that are allowed to pass through the crossings, and the types of goods that are not allowed.

The documentation has been released to the Palestinian Channels in order to help them understand the border crossings better, and to help them plan their relief efforts in the Gaza Strip.

This is a breaking news push that reports an event that is happening in the current time frame and belongs to to the category security.

message:
Gaza channels report an influx of displaced people from many neighborhoods in eastern Khan Yunis and in the south, following rumors of evacuation talks held by Israeli intelligence officers with the residents.
There is no verification of the need for evacuation and the IDF spokesman in Arabic did not publish anything on the subject, but the rumors are doing their job and there are reports of an evacuation movement of residents from these areas.
event_breakdown: Gaza: Influx of displaced people from eastern Khan Yunis and the south following rumors of evacuation talks with residents.

message: And here is 15-year-old Muhammad Sarhan (although he looks much older) holding an improvised explosive inside a fire extinguisher that was converted to the cause.
event_breakdown: Muhammad Sarhan, a 15-year-old (although he appears to be older), was found with an improvised explosive inside a fire extinguisher that had been converted to the cause.

message:
Palestinian channels: "The occupation soldiers shot a 15-year-old boy to death in cold blood, without him doing anything..."

What are they not telling?? 👇👇👇
event_breakdown:
Palestinian channels have reported that Israeli occupation soldiers shot and killed a 15-year-old boy in cold blood. The incident occured in the town of Silwad, which is located in the West Bank. The boy has not been identified yet and the circumstances of the incident are being investigated. The Israeli army has not commented on the killing.

Tensions have been high in the West Bank this week as Palestinian protesters clashed with Israeli forces following the death of a Palestinian man who was killed by Israeli soldiers during a raid in Jenin. The man was wanted by Israeli forces for his involvement in past attacks against Israeli soldiers and civilians. Israeli forces retaliated by shooting and killing two Palestinian men who were allegedly involved in throwing stones at them during the clashes.

The West Bank has been under Israeli military occupation since 1967 and is home to about 2.5 million Palestinians. The area has been plagued by unrest and violence for decades, with Israeli forces regularly conducting raids and arrests in the search for militants or wanted individuals. The Palestinian Authority, which governs the West Bank, has limited control over security and frequently accuses Israel of using excessive force against Palestinian civilians.

message: And for the fans of the "before and after" format... a-Najma Square in Rafah.
location: a-Najma Square in Rafah, Gaza Strip
event_breakdown:
a-Najma Square in Rafah:
On March 31, 2022, Israeli forces launched airstrikes in the Gaza Strip, targeting several locations. The airstrikes were in response to a rocket attack from Gaza earlier that day. a-Najma Square in Rafah was one of several targets hit by Israeli airstrikes. The Israeli military said the airstrikes were aimed at military sites belonging to Hamas, the Islamic militant group that rules Gaza. The strikes come amid heightened tensions between Israel and the Palestinians following a series of deadly attacks in Israel in recent weeks that have killed 11 people.

event_breakdown: IDF maneuvers in Shejaiya neighborhood in eastern Gaza City, target of a reported residential complex explosion.

message:
The elections in France

This is how a geographical map of the results of the first round of the parliamentary elections in France looks like (after counting 99% of the votes):

On the right is the election in 2022
On the left are the elections held yesterday.

Orange is Macron's party.
Dark blue is Marine Le Pen's right-wing party.
Large areas went from orange to dark blue.
event_breakdown:
1. Russian invasion of Ukraine (ongoing)

This invasion started on February 24, 2022, and it is an ongoing event. It is a military action triggered by the Russian forces advancing into the neighboring country in what seems to be an attempt to take over the capital city of Kiev and enforce a new government.

As we can see by taking a look at the votes received by Le Pen's party around the 2022 election, there is a significant raise of the votes received by her, giving the far-right party around 20 to 30% of the votes for the whole country.

message: Dr. Muhammad Abu Salmiya, director of the Shifa Hospital in Gaza, returns to the Strip and tells the media about the "occupation crimes against the medical staff" and the suffering of the Palestinian prisoners and the need to empty the Israeli prisons of Palestinian prisoners.
event_breakdown:
Current events of security reported in text that can be placed on a map include:

* Occupation crimes against the medical staff at Shifa Hospital in Gaza.
* The suffering of Palestinian prisoners in Israeli prisons.
* The need to empty the Israeli prisons of Palestinian prisoners.

Note that these events are happening in the Gaza area, which is located within the Palestinian territories, and the Israeli prisons where the Palestinian prisoners are held are located in the Israeli territory.

message:
Idlib: The conflict between the Syrians and the Turks is intensifying

The Syrian rebels are jeopardizing their relationship with their main sponsor (Turkey) in their war against the Assad regime.

message:
Following the report from earlier 👆👆 on displaced Gazans leaving the neighborhoods of East and South Khan Yunis, the IDF spokesperson has just issued an official evacuation notice, apparently ahead of a military operation in the area. 

Residents are required to move westward towards the humanitarian zone.

message:
Following the attacks by Turks on Syrian refugees in Kayseri and amidst reports of talks between Turkey and the Assad regime in Syria about normalizing relations, Syrian rebels in Idlib (Syria), who oppose the Assad regime and are supported by Turkey, have begun attacking Turkish soldiers in Idlib.

Turkish flags were set on fire, and Turkish military bases in Idlib were attacked by the Syrian crowd, who called for the Turks to leave Idlib.
event_breakdown: Following attacks by Turks on Syrian refugees in Kayseri, Syrian rebels in Idlib began to attack Turkish soldiers.

message:
The city of Kayseri, in central Turkey (Cappadocia): A Turkish mob attacked Syrian refugees and their businesses last night following reports that a Syrian refugee had raped a Turkish child.

The response? 👇
event_breakdown: The Turkish National Police was called in to restore order. Kayseri is a city in central Turkey with a population of over 1 million people. It is located in the region known as Cappadocia.

message: The German airline Lufthansa: We have canceled night flights to and from Beirut for the month of July due security risks.
event_breakdown:
Lufthansa Cancels Night Flights to Beirut Due to Security Risks - July 2023

---

Although it is not uncommon for Lufthansa to cancel night flights, this time they cancelled them through the end of July 2023.

Brian Finn with Lufthansa operations confirmed to Time Out that the airline had pulled the plug on three weekly flights between Munich and Beirut during their annual safety review, therefore cutting off flight scheduling from July through a year later in June 2023, cutting capability for Lebanese customers this summer.

Perhaps in response to the fact that the war in Ukraine spread across Ukraine when main trading routes were accidentally brought down by missiles or landings, according to the BBC. Flight companies have been obliged to stop services over kvack zones, e.g. Hezbollah.

For example, in May 2018 a terrorist attack caused two explosions to occur close to the Israeli embassy in Beirut's Achrafieh district. The blasts injured at least 6 people, including civilians, and damaged the embassy building and other structures in the area. Some sources have attributed these explosions to Israel's Mossad intelligence agency, which has been accused of conducting operations in Lebanon in the past.

Whatever the reasons for their cancellation, Lufthansa's decision highlights the uncertainty that persists in Lebanon and the difficulty of predicting when the situation there will improve. In the meantime, those traveling from Beirut will have to find alternative routes or wait until the security situation improves.

message: "Sewage lakes" are also forming the center of the Gaza Strip.

1. "The Gaza Strip is experiencing a severe humanitarian crisis, with limited access to clean water and electricity. The ongoing blockade and conflict in the region have left the population struggling to survive."
2. "Gaza is experiencing a water crisis due to high levels of pollution and untreated sewage. The coastal aquifer, which provides much of the area's water, has become contaminated, leading to the spread of disease."
3. "In addition to the water pollution, the Gaza Strip is also suffering from a lack of electricity. The power cuts have led to a scarcity of basic necessities such as food and clean water."
4. "Gaza is experiencing a worsening humanitarian crisis, with limited access to clean water and electricity."
5. "The Gaza Strip is facing a sanitation crisis, with garbage piling up in the streets and sewage overflowing into the streets."
6. "Gaza is also facing a shortage of fuel due to the ongoing blockade, leading to power outages and increased prices."
7. "The ongoing blockade of the Gaza Strip is having a severe impact on the economy, with unemployment and poverty rates on the rise."
8. "The Gaza Strip is experiencing a water crisis due to high levels of pollution and untreated sewage."
9. "Gaza is also experiencing a shortage of fuel due to the ongoing blockade, leading to power outages and increased prices."
10. "The Gaza Strip is facing a water crisis due to high levels of pollution and untreated sewage."

message:
Khan Yunis: Following the evacuation announcement by the IDF spokesperson this evening, Gazans packed their bags (again) and moved west to the heart of the city of Khan Yunis and the humanitarian zone. According to Gazan sources, the plaza of the Nasser Hospital in Khan Yunis was filled to capacity with the displaced.

There is criticism among Gazans on social media against the Hamas operatives who fired today's rockets at Israel from the Khan Yunis area - something that led to the evacuation of the Palestinian population from there.

message: The U.S. Embassy in Lebanon has issued another warning (the second in four days), advising American citizens to reconsider traveling to Lebanon, since the complex security environment in the country can change quickly.
event_breakdown:
Complex security environment in Lebanon
New warning for US citizens to reconsider traveling to Lebanon due to complex security environment.

The security environment in Lebanon can change quickly, the U.S. Embassy announced, warning that US citizens might not get assistance in case of violence. The new warning follows a series of bomb attacks in the country.
